TestDescription.name: Ektron CMS multiple vulnerabilities
TestDescription.Description:
The web application is vulnerable to multiple security vulnerabilities, such as unauthenticated file upload and XML eXternal Entities (XXE) injection. [break][break]
[bold]1. Unauthenticated File Upload: [/bold][break] The form /WorkArea/Upload.aspx does not require authentication to upload a file. By issuing a POST request with a webshell embedded in a JPEG image and specifying the ASPX extension it is possible to upload ASPX code to /uploadedimages/. The ASPX code is placed in the comment section of the JPEG so that it survives image resizing.
[break][break] [bold]2. XXE Injection: [/bold][break] The XML parser at /WorkArea/Blogs/xmlrpc.aspx is vulnerable to XML external entity attacks which can be used to scan behind perimeter firewalls or possibly include files from the local file system e.g.
TestDescription.Impact: An attacker can upload and execute arbitrary code on the server.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade to version 8.6 and remove the /WorkArea/Blogs/xmlrpc.aspx file.

Reference.database: Sense of Security - Security Advisory - SOS-12-009
